meta.summary: With top pair decent kicker on a brick turn, we have a clear value bet. BB's checking range is capped after calling flop, making our AJ strong enough to bet for value.
solverNotes: AJ is in the top 20% of our range on this runout
BB's check-call range is mostly Kx and draws that missed
33% sizing allows us to get called by worse while keeping draws in
Checking risks giving a free card to hands with equity

meta.summary: Our flush draw missed and we have just T-high. Checking back gives us the best chance to win at showdown against busted draws in villain's range.
solverNotes: T9 has no showdown value against BB's calling range
Bluffing is -EV because villain reached river with mostly strong hands
Our hand blocks some of villain's folds (heart draws)
Checking preserves our equity and lets villain bluff sometimes

meta.summary: We have a strong combo draw with overcards and a gutshot plus flush draw. C-betting small builds the pot for when we hit while also having fold equity.
solverNotes: KJcc has ~55% equity vs BB's continuing range
Small sizing allows us to c-bet wide on this coordinated board
We have 9 flush outs + 4 straight outs (some dirty)
33% sizing lets us bet frequently without overinvesting
